oai_dc:dc.dc:title: US carbine cartridge box
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The leather box held twenty rounds of ammunition for carbines. The box is associated with Sgt. J. G. Macomber, 6th Vt. Inf. Regt., USA. He was killed at the battle of the Wilderness, May 6, 1864. It would be unusual for an infantrymen to have a cavalry carbine cartridge box. There was a Francis Macomber which served in Co. A, 1st Vt. Cav. Regt., USA. The maker is W. Kinsey & Co., Newark, N.J. Kinsey had contracts for 15,000 sets of cavalry accoutrements in and another for 3,465 cavalry cartridge boxes.
